properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 5 at 8:19PM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
...The flood warning continues for the following river in
Kentucky...

Green River at Paradise
Green River at Calhoun

.Heavy rainfall that has fallen across the Green River basin is
forecast to cause rises along the river. Paradise is in flood, and
is forecast to crest at 385.6 feet early Friday. Meanwhile, Calhoun
Kentucky will go above flood stage late Wednesday and then is
forecast to crest at 25.2 feet early Sunday.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Green River at Calhoun.
* from Thursday evening until further notice.
* At  7:00 PM Wednesday the stage was 18.9 feet.
* Flood Stage is 23.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by tomorrow late evening and
continue to rise to near 25.2 feet by early Sunday morning.
Additional rises are possible thereafter.
* Impact...At 26.0 Feet...Moderate flooding occurs with thousands of
acreage flooded in the Island, Rumsey, and Jewel City areas.
properties.instruction:
SAFETY MESSAGE...

Never drive cars...trucks or sport utility vehicles through flooded
areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow
children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather
Radio or your local media for further statements and possible updated
forecasts.

Additional information is available at
http://www.crh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=pah /lower case/
